p: Influenza A virus is a highly infectious seasonal pathogen responsible for substantial global morbidity and mortality. Annual epidemics affect 5–10% of adults and 20–30% of children, and cause approximately half a million deaths worldwide [ 1]. The economic impact of this infectious disease is similarly staggering; the total annual economic burden of influenza epidemics in the United States alone is estimated to be over $87 billion considering both direct medical costs and lost earnings [ 2].
